comment.author: 52454267@N00
comment._content: This is great!  It shows the Studebaker factory/showroom building (built in 1885) before it added some stories and became the Fine Arts Building (in 1898).  (The floors behind the arched windows were the showrooms for Studebaker horse-drawn carriages, and the smaller windows above were for the assembly of the carriages.)  You can also see that Adler & Sullivan's Auditorium Building had not gone up yet, to the left.

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content:
Viewers interested in the modern-day history of this building may be interested in the following illustrated post: "The Fine Arts Gets a Face-Lift" on the website Celia Her City.

I appreciate Cornell's making this magnificent photograph available online.
Susan Barsy, PhD
